summary: This document is a chain of emails from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY) regarding travel approval requests for prosecutors and staff to conduct witness interviews in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). The emails detail planned trips to locations including Pensacola, Los Angeles, West Palm Beach, and Stockholm, Sweden, between March 2019 and February 2020.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Primary author of multiple travel approval requests for the Epstein investigation team to interview witnesses in various locations.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Frequently mentioned as a team member traveling with Alex or Maurene to conduct witness interviews for the Epstein case.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Frequently mentioned as a team member traveling with Alex or Alison to conduct witness interviews for the Epstein case.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: The official who approves travel authorization requests for the Epstein investigation team.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: Responsible for booking travel (flights, hotels, conference rooms) for the investigation team.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Coordinates travel authorizations and logistics, reminding team about tax forms and payment requests.

persons.name: Cynthia Perez
persons.context: Copied on travel approval and logistics emails.

persons.name: Nick Siu
persons.context: Mentioned as the recipient for conference room payment requests.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation, United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.

events.title: Witness Interview in Pensacola
events.description: Planned interview of a witness in Pensacola, Florida, requiring travel by prosecutors Alex and Alison, and booking of a conference room.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Planned meetings and victim interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, with team composition dependent on victim scheduling.

keyFacts: The document reveals ongoing, active investigation into Jeffrey Epstein (case 2018R01618) by the SDNY USAO from at least March 2019 through February 2020.
Prosecutors traveled extensively to interview witnesses and victims, including international travel to Sweden, indicating the investigation's wide scope.
The investigation involved specific logistical protocols, including booking conference rooms at hotels for interviews and using domestic carriers for international travel when possible.
The email chain shows a pattern of routine internal approval for investigation-related travel, managed by administrative staff like Darlene Alleyne and Michele Duncan.
The case is formally titled 'United States v. Epstein' and relates to 'enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
